num_tested_probands: The document describes a single case report of a 31-year-old man.
There is mention of a 31-year-old patient, which indicates one proband was tested.
num_positive_het_probands: The proband tested has compound heterozygous mutations in WARS2.
There is no clear mention of a proband being heterozygous for a pathogenic variant.
positive_phenotypes: The reported clinical phenotypes include severe hyperkinetic movement disorder and cognitive deficits among others.
The clinical presentation note describes the following phenotypes: 'severe hyperkinetic movement disorder' and 'uncontrollable dystonic and ballistic movements'.
num_compound_or_double_hets: The report clearly describes the patient as having two variants in WARS2, suggestive of compound heterozygosity.
The report is about a case study involving WARS2 and suggests compound heterozygosity without explicit enumeration.
